pr_title: Create a new factory for testing an IIDM network with all equipments

timeline.message:
Create a new factory for testing a network with all equipments

The network is composed of four substations, with 5 voltage levels.
The loadflow converges on the network with Open Loadflow and Hades2.
With Hades2, one of the generators switches from PV to PQ during the computation.
To go further with this test, we could add more transformers.
It was created at first to test the remote measurements are correctly set on all due equipments on the French network.
Thus, it does not contain any 3 windings transformer.

Signed-off-by: Agnès Leroy <agnes.leroy@rte-france.com>

Fixes in the network, add a sketch

Signed-off-by: Agnès Leroy <agnes.leroy@rte-france.com>

FIxes by Anne to improve the loadflow computation

Signed-off-by: Agnès Leroy <agnes.leroy@rte-france.com>

timeline.bodyText: Country is optional, so you can let it unset for test cases.
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: It's weird to initialize only the low voltage limit. Initialize both voltage limits (80% and 120% are the common values), or none.
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Breaker should be retained, but Disconnector should not.
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText:
Switch voltage limits to have 80% and 120% of the nominal voltage.
It seems your transformer TWT is connected between two voltage levels with the same nominal voltage. Maybe you should change the nominal voltage of all the VL to 400kV except the S1VL1
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText:
S1VL2_AH should be retained.
I think it could be better if some disconnector are open. Equipments should not be connected to both busbar section. Edit your schema to change the black circles (connected) to white circles (disconnected)
I think you should add disconnectors for your coupler on the schema 0-7 and 1-6
I think there is a mistake for S1VL2_AF, S1VL2_AG and S1VL2_AH: should be 19-20, 21-22 and 23-24?
The topology close to LD2 is really strange, and not really realistic.
Maybe you should add a breaker for LCC1
There is an inconsistency for the switch 0-25: it doesn't exist in the code, but it exists on the schema.
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Look like a breaker in the schema
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText:
You should add a breaker for your line
On the schema connect it on the left of the S3VL1 to make it more readable
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.message:
Fixes to the network based on Mathieu's review. The sketch is updated too.

Signed-off-by: Agnès Leroy <agnes.leroy@rte-france.com>

Fix the network topology and simplify java source

Signed-off-by: Agnès Leroy <agnes.leroy@rte-france.com>

timeline.bodyText:
It's in kV not in percentage :)
So it would make more sense to have limits like 220/240.
Same thing on other voltage levels of course.
timeline.author: sylvlecl

replies.bodyText: I think Agnes misunderstand my comment: I suggest to have 80/120 percent...
replies.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText:
I know it has nothing to do with the PR, but do you confirm it should be percentages here?
Maybe there's an opportunity to add it in the javadoc, because it's not obvious today.

replies.bodyText: Yes, it is a percentage. See how do we process it in OLF: https://github.com/powsybl/powsybl-open-loadflow/blob/master/src/main/java/com/powsybl/openloadflow/network/impl/LfBusImpl.java
replies.author: geofjamg

timeline.bodyText:
Maybe for an HVDC it would make more sense to have a diagram which starts at negative P, so that reactive limits are defined when it sends AND when it receives power.
Not very important for a test network.

replies.bodyText: I would simply put a -100 value, I guess usually the capabilities of HVDCs are symmetrical, in active power.
replies.author: sylvlecl

timeline.bodyText:
Maybe we should set P and Q on lines terminals to be consistent with other equipements?
It depends whether we want to provide a full computed state or not. If we do, it would be interesting to pass the "loadflow validation" on it !

replies.bodyText: I have now modified the network so that it corresponds to the loadflow results by Hades2, but the loadflow validation fails on generators and buses. I do not understand why though. @annetill could you have a look at it please? Thanks.
replies.author: agnesLeroy

timeline.bodyText:
Not sure it's really useful but maybe we could set a higher value for lines impedance: 0.1 is pretty small, in particular compared to the value of the transformer.
Anyway, it will not change the flows distribution.
timeline.author: sylvlecl
